title: The Grand Canyon
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 213 words, Level H (Grade 1), Lexile 530L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     K and N
description: In the high desert of northern Arizona is a canyon so big that we can see it from space. The Grand Canyon provides students an introduction to this incredible wonder of the world from its from its formation and early explorations to the canyon as we know it today: one of the most popular national parks. The book can also be used to teach students how to discern fact or opinion and to identify synonyms and antonyms. The book and lesson are also available for levels K and N.
meta: canyon, erosion, national park, Native Americans, protected, sediment
Ask and answer questions to understand text
Fact or Opinion : Determine fact or opinion
Initial Sound : Discriminate initial consonant /gr/ sound
Proper Nouns : Recognize and use proper nouns as names of places
Synonyms and Antonyms : Identify synonyms and antonyms

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
